SeloSustentavelPremiacao.title: SUSTAINABLE ATTITUDE – IWPPO
SeloSustentavelPremiacao.intro1: Imagine a world where every small action matters. On beaches, in ports, rivers, and even streets, daily decisions shape the future of the oceans. At IWPPO, we believe that good ideas deserve more than recognition — they deserve to set an example. That’s how the Sustainable Attitude Seal was born: more than an award, a symbol of commitment, creativity, and positive impact.
SeloSustentavelPremiacao.intro2: During the event, participants from different countries and communities are invited to share their stories in videos of up to 3 minutes — showcasing real actions to reduce plastic pollution: from educational campaigns and cleanup initiatives to innovative technologies and simple, replicable solutions.
SeloSustentavelPremiacao.network_text: Receiving the seal means joining a global network of change agents. At the end of the event, the winning videos will be shared internationally, inspiring new actions and amplifying the reach of these attitudes. Each winner receives not only recognition but an invitation: to keep acting and inspiring. The ocean starts in our backyard — and caring for it begins with a choice, today.

destaques.title: Clarity and strength of the message
destaques.desc: A well-told, clear, and coherent story. Audio and image quality that supports understanding.

destaques.title: Relevance and originality of ideas
destaques.desc: Alignment with the theme of plastic pollution, including data, facts, or real examples. Creative approaches score higher.

destaques.title: Community engagement
destaques.desc: Representation and engagement (number/diversity of participants, inclusion of different groups).

destaques.title: Positive environmental impact (proven or potential)
destaques.desc: Concrete, measurable actions with potential for scalability or lasting effects.

destaques.title: Ability to inspire lasting change
destaques.desc: Videos that mobilize, provoke reflection, and encourage new sustainable attitudes.

SeloSustentavelPremiacao.criterios_intro: Each criterion is scored from 0 to 5. Use the guiding questions to validate your video:

criterios.titulo: 1. Clarity and quality of the message
criterios.desc: The video presents the idea clearly, directly, and coherently, with good audio and image quality.
criterios.perguntas: Is the message easily understood? Is there a coherent narrative?

criterios.desc: Directly addresses the theme of plastic pollution in the oceans, with accurate and contextualized information.
criterios.perguntas: Is the video aligned with the central theme? Does it show data, facts, or real examples?

criterios.desc: Representation and community engagement (number and diversity of participants, inclusion of different social groups).
criterios.perguntas: How many people actively participated? Is there age, gender, or cultural diversity?

criterios.desc: Actions with the potential to generate real and measurable positive environmental impact.
criterios.perguntas: Are the actions concrete and replicable? Do they have scalability or lasting effects?

criterios.desc: Creative use of visual, auditory, or narrative resources to convey the message.
criterios.perguntas: Is the video original and engaging? Are there innovative solutions or approaches?

criterios.desc: Ability to motivate the audience to adopt sustainable practices.
criterios.perguntas: Does the video provoke reflection and encourage action?

criterios.desc: Adherence to the 3-minute limit and technical suitability (resolution, framing, editing).
criterios.perguntas: Is the video within the time limit and technically suitable?

escala: 4 = Meets well, with minor adjustments possible
5 = Meets excellently, with no adjustments needed

AboutSection.title: About the Event

section1.heading: II IWPPO 2025
section1.paragraph: The IWPPO was born from the need to discuss and find solutions to one of the greatest environmental challenges of our time: plastic pollution in the oceans. Originating from CEMEIA (Environmental Studies Congress) and supported by CAPES (PAEP Call) and CNPq, our workshop brings together international experts in an interdisciplinary approach.

section2.heading: Our Approach
section2.paragraph: The workshop combines scientific research, public policy, and technological innovation to address the issue of plastic pollution. With participants from various countries, we promote the exchange of knowledge and practical solutions.

highlights: Endorsed by the UN Executive Committee
Aligned with SDG 14 - Life Below Water

ineditismo.title: Originality
ineditismo.desc: Only original works will be accepted.

modalidades.desc: Participants may present their work in one of the following formats: Oral presentation or E-poster/banner (no physical printing required).

formato.title: Accepted Format

idiomas.title: Accepted Languages
idiomas.desc: Papers may be written in Portuguese, English, or Spanish.

autores.desc: Each work may have up to 6 authors/co-authors (including the main author).

limites.title: Limit of Papers per Participant
limites.desc: Main author: up to 2 papers; Co-author: up to 5 papers.

avaliacao.title: Evaluation Criteria
avaliacao.desc: Papers will be evaluated in two stages: (1) preliminary evaluation by the steering committee and (2) evaluation by the Scientific Committee, considering originality, contribution, methodological rigor, writing quality, and relevance to the state of the art.
avaliacao.escala: Very Poor = 1, Poor = 2, Fair = 3, Good = 4, Very Good = 5. Papers with an average score of 4 or higher will be accepted.
avaliacao.resultados: E-poster/banner presentation: 1-hour display (recommended template available on the website). Oral presentation: 10 minutes of presentation + 5 minutes for questions (recommended template available on the website).

EixosTematicos.descricao: Choose one of the tracks below to submit your scientific paper
EixosTematicos.envie_trabalho: Submit your paper now on Doity

itens.descricao: This thematic track addresses the current state of the oceans in the face of contemporary environmental challenges. It aims to gather studies that assess the health of marine ecosystems, highlighting indicators of environmental degradation, biodiversity loss, acidification, overfishing, and climate change impacts. Research using monitoring tools, ocean modeling, and conservation policy evaluation is also welcome. The goal is to provide a comprehensive and scientific overview of the real condition of the oceans on local, regional, and global scales.

This track covers research focused on the identification, characterization, and mitigation of pollutants in marine environments, with a special emphasis on emerging contaminants such as microplastics, nanoplastics, pharmaceutical residues, pesticides, and heavy metals. Studies investigating sources, dispersion routes, ecotoxicological effects, and potential solutions for these contaminants are expected. Innovative approaches in detection technologies, remediation, and prevention strategies focused on marine sustainability are also included.

itens.titulo: Science with Purpose: Applied Ocean Research
itens.descricao: This track highlights applied science as a strategic tool to address ocean challenges. Research involving remote sensing monitoring, climate modeling, marine biotechnology, and solutions based on emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence and Big Data is welcome. The focus is on generating technical knowledge with a direct impact on conservation, management, and sustainable use of the seas.

This track addresses the importance of traditional knowledge and the protagonism of coastal communities in ocean preservation. It values interdisciplinary studies on sustainable practices, environmental justice, and the impacts of the climate crisis on the lives of indigenous peoples, artisanal fishers, shellfish gatherers, and riverine communities. It encourages dialogue between science and local knowledge as a strategy for fairer and more effective policies.

This track focuses on the dissemination of scientific knowledge and the strengthening of ocean culture. It includes initiatives for science popularization, educational material production, actions in schools and communities, and communication strategies aimed at social mobilization and support for public policies. Studies exploring risk communication in the context of the climate crisis are also expected.

This track explores the role of public policies in the protection and sustainable management of the oceans. It covers topics such as multilateral agreements, the creation of marine protected areas, national legal instruments, participatory governance, and transparency in coastal management. The track seeks to connect science, society, and the state to promote effective and equitable ocean governance.

This track promotes innovative approaches to the regeneration and preservation of marine environments. It includes research on coastal ecosystem restoration, ocean renewable energies, blue economy, sustainable production chains, and nature-based technologies. The goal is to encourage solutions that balance socioeconomic development with ecological integrity.

itens.titulo: Oceans and Climate: Interactions and Impacts
itens.descricao: This track analyzes the role of the oceans in the global climate system and the effects of climate change on marine and coastal environments. Studies on extreme events, sea level rise, acidification, impacts on vulnerable communities, and mitigation and adaptation strategies are welcome. The emphasis is on understanding and responding to climate risks with a solid scientific basis.

douglas-apratto.bio: Holds a degree in History from the Federal University of Alagoas (1972), a master’s degree in History from the Federal University of Pernambuco (1992), and a doctorate in History from the Federal University of Pernambuco (1994). Currently a professor at Cesmac University Center. Has experience in research, with an emphasis on Regional History.

alexander.bio: Full professor at the Oceanographic Institute of the University of São Paulo.

fabio-guedes.bio: Full Professor at UFAL, President Director of FAPEAL, Executive Secretary of ICTP.Br, Coordinator of the Science and Funding Chamber of the Northeast Consortium, former Secretary of Education of Alagoas, and former President of CONFAP.

nidia.bio: Nídia Noemi Fabré is a biologist, graduated in 1983, with a doctorate in Biological Sciences (1992) from the National University of Mar del Plata, Argentina. She worked as a researcher at the Argentine Institute for Fisheries Research and Development and as a professor at the National University of Mar del Plata between 1984 and 1988. She was a collaborating researcher at the Max Planck Institute, under a scientific cooperation agreement with the National Institute for Amazon Research (INPA), between 1991 and 1997, as well as a professor-advisor in the Postgraduate Program in Tropical Biology at INPA/UFAM and the Postgraduate Program in Environmental Sciences and Sustainability in the Amazon until 2006. Between 1997 and 2006, she was a professor at the Federal University of Amazonas (Institute of Biological Sciences), working in the area of Ecology, and coordinator of the Integrated Aquatic Resources and Floodplain Program – PYRÁ. She designed the Postgraduate Program in Environmental Sciences and Sustainability in the Amazon, which she coordinated between 1999 and 2003, before taking on the Technical-Scientific Directorate of the Amazonas State Research Support Foundation (FAPEAM), a position she held until June 2005, receiving an honorable mention for her performance in strengthening the state science and technology system. She coordinated the project 'Fisheries and Management of Large Migratory Catfish in the Amazon' (2003–2005), funded by UNDP/Provárzea-IBAMA, with the participation of three Brazilian federal institutions and the SINCHI Institute (Colombia). The project resulted in the development of an integrated and participatory management plan for these species in the Amazon Basin, with measures for neighboring countries, published as a book in 2005. Since 2006, she has been a professor at the Federal University of Alagoas, where she designed the Postgraduate Program in Biological Diversity and Conservation in the Tropics (ICBS/UFAL), where she is a permanent professor and served as coordinator for two terms. She conducts research in ecology and fisheries resource management since the beginning of her career, with scientific production including over 150 titles: 93 articles in national and international journals, 31 book chapters, and 7 organized books. She has supervised 27 master’s dissertations and 11 doctoral theses. Her technical-scientific career is associated with the conservation of natural resources, with an emphasis on fisheries and the socio-environmental development of communities using these resources. Since 2017, she has been part of the Long-Term Ecological Research Program – PELD Costa dos Corais Alagoas (CNPq/FAPEAL), coordinating the second cycle (2020–2024), conducting research on estuarine fish ecology, assessment of tropical marine fisheries resources, and socio-environmental actions with traditional communities in the Costa dos Corais APA.

katia-viana.bio: Katia conducts studies on biodiversity and conservation of aquatic environments in the Amazon region.

neto.cargo: Pro-Rector of Management and Planning at Cesmac University Center
neto.bio: Graduated in Law from the institution itself, he holds a postgraduate degree in Business Management from Fundação Getúlio Vargas (FGV/RJ) and a master’s degree in Education, focusing on Educational Public Policies, from the University City of São Paulo (UNICID). He also has military training, being a 2nd Lieutenant in the Brazilian Army Reserve. Throughout his career, he has stood out for his strategic performance in academic and administrative management, significantly contributing to the strengthening of higher education in the state. He is a member of the Board of Directors of ABMES – Brazilian Association of Higher Education Maintainers and a councilor of FEJAL – Jayme de Altavila Educational Foundation.

CF.bio: Frigate Captain Rodrigo Ribeiro Gonçalves Garcia joined the Brazilian Navy in 1997 as a student at the Merchant Marine Officer Training School. In 2000, he became an Aspirant at the Naval School, reaching the rank of Frigate Captain on December 25, 2021. Throughout his career, he has held significant roles aboard various ships, such as the Corvette Frontin, the Frigates Niterói, Constituição, and União, the Oceanic Patrol Vessel Amazonas, and the High Seas Tugboat Almirante Guillobel. The officer was in charge of the Patrol Vessel Barracuda, commanded the River Patrol Vessel Raposo Tavares, and currently serves as the Captain of the Ports of Alagoas. Before assuming command of the Captaincy, he served in the Navy General Staff, coordinating all Navy exercises and operations abroad. His training includes a degree in Naval Sciences, with a specialization in Electronics, and courses in joint staff, peacekeeping operations, maritime security, intelligence, and international crisis analysis. He has been awarded several decorations, including the Silver Military Medal, the Meritorious Sailor Medal, the United Nations Peacekeepers Medal (UNIFIL), the Amazon Service Medal, the OAS Peace Operations Medal, and the Tamandaré Merit Medal.

PalestrantesConfirmados.descricao: Meet the experts who will share their knowledge at IWPPO

robson-santos.palestra: Presentation of the main results of research from the focal points of the Plastic Oceans project
robson-santos.biografia: Robson is a researcher in oceanography, focusing on plastic pollution, with over 15 years of experience in marine monitoring and conservation projects.

katia-viana.biografia: Katia conducts studies on biodiversity and conservation of aquatic environments in the Amazon region.

fernando-lopez.instituicao: Climate and Earth Center of HEC Paris
fernando-lopez.biografia: Fernando is an international researcher specializing in marine ecology and sustainable ocean management, with extensive experience in global projects.

scott-wilson.biografia: Dr. Scott Wilson is a Senior Honorary Researcher at Macquarie University and the Research Director of the Total Environment Centre’s Microplastics Assessment Project, a citizen-driven data collection and education program designed to raise awareness and provide solutions for microplastic pollution. He is an aquatic toxicologist and, over the past 20 years, has researched the impacts of plastics and marine debris in aquatic environments, both in Australia and internationally. His current focus is understanding the sources and impacts of plastics in the environment while collaborating with stakeholders and the community to help reduce these inputs. By working together on this issue, Dr. Wilson believes we can all make a difference!

fernando-miguel.palestra: Geotechnologies Applied to the Analysis and Mitigation of Environmental Impacts
fernando-miguel.biografia: Fernando is a specialist in geotechnologies applied to environmental management, with a focus on coastal zones.

helena-fernandez.palestra: Territorial Management in the Detection of Plastics in the Oceans
helena-fernandez.biografia: Helena researches territorial management strategies to combat marine plastic pollution.

cristiane-siqueira.instituicao: University of Vassouras - Rio de Janeiro
cristiane-siqueira.palestra: Development of biosensors for detecting pollutants and microplastics in water resources
cristiane-siqueira.biografia: Cristiane specializes in public policies and coastal management with an emphasis on plastic detection.

biagio.palestra: Emergy and Ecological Justice: A new basis for shared responsibility in the oceans
biagio.biografia: Biagio F. Giannetti holds a PhD and Master’s degree from the University of São Paulo (USP). He began his career at Paulista University (UNIP) in 1992 as an Adjunct Professor and currently holds the position of Full Professor. At UNIP, he coordinated undergraduate courses in chemical engineering and food engineering (1996-2000) and, since 1998, has been a permanent professor in the Postgraduate Program in Production Engineering (Master’s, Doctoral, and Postdoctoral levels), as well as leading research activities at the Production and Environment Laboratory (LaProMA). Since 2005, he has been a leader of a research group registered with the CNPq Research Groups Directory. From 2016 to 2024, he was a Visiting Professor at Beijing Normal University (China) under the National Program for Recruiting High-Level Foreign Experts. He also served as a Visiting Professor at the University of Sonora (Mexico, 2013 and 2019) and the University of Florence (Italy, 2022). Professor Giannetti is the author of over 300 scientific publications, including books, articles, and conference papers, focusing on production and the environment. His Scopus h-index is 37, and his Google Scholar i10-index is 115. He was President of the International Society for the Advancement of Emergy Research (2023–2025) and is currently an Honorary Council Member and Associate Editor of the Journal of Cleaner Production, Associate Editor of Frontiers in Energy Research, and Global Director and founder of the Advances in Cleaner Production Network.

federico-sulis.palestra: Closing the Cycle: Sustainability Assessment of Cobogós with Marine Plastic Waste
federico-sulis.biografia: Dr. Federico Sulis holds a degree in Natural Sciences from the University of Cagliari (2006), a Master’s degree in Ecotoxicology from the University of Siena (2011), and a specialization in the design and control of environmental management systems ISO 14001 and EMAS from the Tuscany EMAS ECOLABEL School (2014). He recently completed a PhD in Production Engineering at Paulista University (2023). He has experience in Environmental Sciences, with an emphasis on Production Engineering, focusing on Cleaner Production, Industrial Ecology, Ecotoxicology, Sustainable Development, and Waste Recycling. He is currently a postdoctoral researcher at the Production and Environment Laboratory (LAPROMA) of the Postgraduate Program in Production Engineering (PPEG) at Paulista University (UNIP), where he conducts research in partnership with the Emergy and Ecosystem Resilience Laboratory (LERE) of the Postgraduate Program in Environmental Systems Analysis (PPGASA) at Cesmac University Center.

marcell.palestra: Life cycle assessment and microplastics: an overview
marcell.biografia: Dr. Marcell Mariano Corrêa Maceno is an Environmental Engineer from the Federal University of Paraná (2007), with a specialization in Quality and Environmental Auditing from the Federal Technological University of Paraná (2010), and a Master’s and PhD in Water Resources and Environmental Engineering from the Federal University of Paraná (2010 and 2015). He is currently an Associate Professor IV at UFPR in the Production Engineering course, focusing on environmental management and product design. He coordinates the Postgraduate Program in Production Engineering (Master’s level) at UFPR, the Brazilian Network for Life Cycle Impact Assessment (RAICV), and is a member of the Advances in Cleaner Production Network (ACPN). He has been working in environmental management and sustainability since 2008, with current research related to product life cycle assessment, DfX for improving material and energy use, circular economy, sustainability assessment of systems, and product circularity evaluation.

alireza.instituicao: University of the West of England, UK; University of Cape Town, South Africa
alireza.palestra: Recycling plastic pollution into construction solutions for net-zero goals
alireza.biografia: Dr. Alireza Moghayedi is a researcher and educator focused on sustainability, with over 20 years of experience in the Engineering and Built Environment industry. He is the Research Leader in Digital Built Environment at the School of Architecture and Environment at the University of the West of England, Bristol, a senior researcher at the University of Johannesburg, and the founder and co-director of S+CUBE at the University of Cape Town. His research focuses on developing inclusive, sustainable, and smart solutions for engineering infrastructure and built environment projects, using innovative technologies. He serves as the Principal Investigator for several international research projects, collectively valued at over £30 million. His work has been published in leading academic journals and conferences and has received numerous awards for research and teaching. Dr. Moghayedi is an accredited project manager and has held various roles in government agencies, engineering consultancies, and construction and development companies worldwide.

barbara-pinheiro.palestra: Frontiers of Science and Policy in Addressing Plastic Pollution
barbara-pinheiro.biografia: Biologist, Master’s, and PhD in Oceanography from UFPE. Researcher at PACTO MAR| UNIFESP| Maré de Ciências. Member of the Executive Secretariat of the Women’s League for the Ocean and the National Committee of the Ocean Decade. Coordinator of Black Women in Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Science.

jemille.palestra: Frontiers of Science and Policy in Addressing Plastic Pollution
jemille.biografia: Marine biologist and PhD in Ecology from UFRJ, she works with interdisciplinary research focused on governance, scientific diplomacy, marine conservation, climate change, and ocean pollution. She is part of the UNESCO Chair for Ocean Sustainability and coordinates initiatives such as the Clean Ocean Network and the GT-COP30 of the Women’s League for the Ocean. She was the Deputy Coordinator of the O20-G20 and an articulator of the National Plastic-Free Ocean Strategy. She serves as a consultant on socio-environmental impact projects, including the Polen Future Waves Program.

jornalista.palestra: Planet or Plastic? - Stories from journalistic coverage
jornalista.biografia: Award-winning journalist with over two decades of coverage on environmental issues. Sailed from Oiapoque to Chuí for the Mar sem Fim project. Hosted a radio program at Rádio Eldorado for 10 years and coordinated socio-environmental projects at the station. For two years, she was a field producer in the Javari Valley for documentarian Céline Cousteau. She hosts Vozes do Planeta, a pioneering environmental podcast in Brazil with nine years of history, and the Women in Conservation multimedia project. She is a contributor to O Eco, GO Outside, and National Geographic Brazil and a Pulitzer Center fellow. She is also a co-creator of the Women’s League for the Ocean. She is the co-director of the documentary Women in Conservation, awarded at the Female Film Festival 2023, best environmental film at the Montreal Women Film Festival and Toronto International Women Film Festival in 2024, and executive producer of the documentary At the Top of the Amazon in Search of New Species, about USP’s unprecedented expedition to Serra do Imeri, western Amazonas.

vazquez.palestra: Emission pathways of macro- and microplastics to the Pacific Ocean in Peru: detection and quantification
vazquez.biografia: Dr. Ian Vázquez-Rowe graduated in Biology in 2006 from the University of Texas at Arlington. He pursued postgraduate studies in Environmental Engineering at the University of Santiago de Compostela – USC (2006-2008). In October 2008, he began his research career at USC, where he obtained his PhD in Chemical Engineering in July 2012. From January 2012 to December 2013, Dr. Vázquez-Rowe continued his research career as an R&D Engineer in Environmental Assessment and Management at the Centre de Recherche Public Henri Tudor (now LIST, in Luxembourg). He is currently a Full Professor in the Engineering Department at the Pontifical Catholic University of Peru. He is also an editor of Ocean Resources and Marine Conservation at the International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment. His main research interests are related to environmental management, including life cycle methods, their methodological improvement, and their combination with other methods. Additionally, fisheries and agriculture, food systems in general, and waste and wastewater treatment systems, including plastic emissions to water bodies, have been the focus of his research in recent years. In 2021, he was included in Reuters’ Hot List of the world’s top 1,000 climate scientists and annually ranks among the top 2% of researchers worldwide, according to Stanford University.

clemilson.palestra: Athena Platform: Innovation in the management of Brazilian research and scientific production
clemilson.biografia: Specialist in postgraduate evaluation and higher education public policies, Clemilson Marques Batista has over 25 years of experience in the National Postgraduate System (SNPG). He worked for eight years in the Evaluation Directorate of CAPES, notably contributing to the training of Pro-Rectors, Coordinators, and technical teams of Postgraduate Programs across the country. He also served as an advisor in the Pro-Rector’s offices of the Methodist Universities of São Paulo (UMESP) and Piracicaba (UNIMEP), where he was responsible for liaising with CAPES, CNPq, and managing the academic secretariat of Stricto Sensu courses. As the founder and director of JANUS EDUCARE, he provided specialized consultancy to dozens of public and private universities, including UFRJ, USP, UNB, UPM, UNICAP, UFSC, and FGV, assisting in the creation, reformulation, and evaluation of master’s and doctoral programs, always focusing on compliance with CAPES criteria and the academic sustainability of the programs. He is the creator of the Athena Platform, designed based on his field experience and oriented toward the digital transformation of postgraduate evaluation and management. He currently leads the strategic expansion of the Athena project, focusing on partnerships, technological validation, and national and international scalability.

aldilane.palestra: Microplastics in the Human Placenta: Evidence in Alagoas and the International Scenario
aldilane.biografia: PhD candidate in Materials Science (PPGM) with a sandwich period at the University of Hawaii at Manoa (Hawaii, USA), Master’s in Health Sciences (PPGCS), and Bachelor’s in Biological Sciences from the Federal University of Alagoas (UFAL). Member of the Women’s Health and Pregnancy Research Group, which is part of the Cellular Biology Laboratory/UFAL. She has experience and collaborates on projects in Cellular Biology, Biophysics, Biochemistry, and currently studies the bioaccumulation and effects of microplastics in the human placenta.

gomes.palestra: Multi-scalar governance: articulation between Basin Committees, municipalities, and states in combating plastic pollution
gomes.biografia: Holds a degree in Civil Engineering from the Federal University of Alagoas (1987), a Master’s in Hydraulic Engineering and Sanitation from the University of São Paulo (1995), and a PhD in Hydraulic Engineering and Sanitation from the University of São Paulo (2002). He is currently a researcher at the Water Reuse Laboratory (LRA) and a Full Professor at the Technology Center (CTEC) of the Federal University of Alagoas (UFAL). He is the President of the Pratagy Hydrographic Basin Committee. He has experience in Sanitary Engineering and Environmental Management, with an emphasis on Advanced Water Treatment Techniques, focusing on Biological Wastewater Treatment for reuse, Water Quality, Basic Sanitation Systems, and Environmental Impact Assessments.

bessa.palestra: Assessment of the impacts of human activities, with a special focus on (micro)plastic pollution, on marine ecosystems
bessa.biografia: Filipa Bessa is a biologist, professor in the Department of Life Sciences at the University of Coimbra, and a researcher at the Center for Functional Ecology. Her research has focused on assessing the impacts of human activities, with a particular focus on (micro)plastic pollution, on marine and coastal ecosystems. This work ranges from the Portuguese coastal zone to remote areas such as Antarctica, including projects studying the effects of plastics on Cape Verde turtles, and has expanded her work to study pollution in inland waters and mountain ecosystems. She serves on several international advisory bodies (OSPAR and GESAMP/UNEP) and is a member of the working group that supports the European Commission's Scientific Advisory Mechanism through the micro and nanoplastics working group. She recently created the Zero Pollution Manifesto for UNESCO Biosphere Reserves in Portugal. She coordinates projects related to citizen science - lixomarinho.pt and Portugal Pellets Watch. In parallel, she promotes science communication initiatives (photographic exhibitions and workshops) related to ocean literacy and the problem of marine pollution.
